0.text: Bug 322832  early field resolution leading to problems for ITDs when declare parents in use.

1.text: I have a type that is being used where a generic is being expected.

2.text: That generic specifies an upper bound.

3.text: The type only obeys the upper bound once a declare parents has applied to it.

4.text: I have an intertype declaration (a field).

5.text: When the ITD is applied we do some work to see if it clashes with existing fields.

6.text: This causes existing fields to be resolved.

7.text: If this resolution triggers a bounds check for the declare parents affected type before the declare parents has applied, a problem will be raised.

8.text: Basically if the target of the declare is processed before the intertype then we are ok, but that is luck based.

9.text: We should do the declare parents first (and declare annotation) and then do intertype declarations (since they may trigger this extra resolution).
